column3: str
Sphene stands in silence.
Speak with Sphene.
Contact your allies from the designated location.
Speak with Sphene.
Speak with Milos in residential radius 9-14.
Heading below? I'd be glad to show you the way!
Proceed to the throne room?
The Endless Sphene was just a projected image outside Living Memory, so it was a bit of a surprise to see an actual item that belonged to her.
On the way back, I asked Shale why the tiara might have been in the throne room.
She believes that it was being used to record Sphene's actions. There's no way to tell now whether or not it was with her knowledge...
But it can't be used for questionable ends anymore, so we can at least take comfort in that.
I'm glad everyone's safe!
The interference made it impossible to locate you, and prevented linkpearl transmissions besides...
Apologies that we couldn't be there for the critical moment, but as usual you found a way to handle matters.
Calyx seems to consider the reflections naught but fields to be harvested for his Endless.
I do not make a habit of dismissing the assertions of others out of hand, but I cannot abide such callous disregard for life.
Based on the geographic data I gathered, it seems the inner section containing the castle served as a residential area during the early stages of Everkeep's construction.

The outer section was then added when they expanded the structure into its present-day shape. I expect the system to dry the earth was installed so that they could build a stable foundation on submerged land.
The simulant gave the impression that she wouldn't be back, but I suppose only time will tell. And at present, we have no further leads on Calyx...
For now, perhaps you could take a moment to contact our friends.
It would be good to catch each other up on recent developments, and I am certain everyone would appreciate hearing from you.
Come to think of it, I have no idea what Erenville's up to...
I'll take a look at the Preservation terminal. Hopefully there'll be something useful.
I shall take the opportunity to review the books from the castle...and one grimoire in particular.
Most of the tomes we found were dilapidated from age, but some are thankfully still legible.
Y'shtola, Alphinaud, Alisaie, and Erenville should all be somewhere within the dome. Pray do the honors in any order you like.
It irks me to think we're being led on by Calyx, but I'll do my best to find clues of his passage.
Who will you contact?
Y'shtola.
Alphinaud.
Alisaie.
Erenville.
(-Y'shtola-)If it isn't <Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>. Is something the matter?
(-Y'shtola-)...So Preservation is behind the recent intrigue. It doesn't surprise me. I'm glad to hear you are none the worse for your trials, though.
(-Y'shtola-)As for myself, I've just concluded a meeting with Gossan. I told him about the cure for levin sickness, and we formed a tentative plan to treat all those who are stricken.
(-Y'shtola-)I'm now otherwise unoccupied, so I shall take a look around the government sector to see if aught is amiss.
(-Y'shtola-)And if this Calyx is obsessed with the key, then I ought to begin studying it in earnest as well.
(-Alphinaud-)Ah, excellent timing, my friend. I had a mind to call you myself to see how you were faring.
(-Alphinaud-)Calyx... While something was obviously afoot, I couldn't have imagined that such an individual would be involved.
(-Alphinaud-)'Tis well you were able to prevent the simulant from sowing further uncertainty. That said, her absence may have consequences.
(-Alphinaud-)The people of Alexandria still have great trust in Sphene─'tis plain in the way they speak of her even now, and in how the simulant was able to win them over.
(-Alphinaud-)When they notice she has ceased to appear again, rumor and worry will spread. We must be mindful of any pronounced shift in the mood of the populace.
(-Alphinaud-)But forgive me─it's been battle after battle for you, hasn't it? We can handle ourselves for now, so pray rest up while you can and recover your strength.
(-Alisaie-)Yes, hello! ...<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>!? For you to call out of the blue, is something wrong?
(-Alisaie-)...What? You went all the way to the bottom of Everkeep, and you didn't think to ask me to come!?
(-Alisaie-)<sigh> But I suppose I've been fairly busy myself...
(-Alisaie-)I'm pleased to say that we've received permission to begin administering the cure for levin sickness to citizens.
(-Alisaie-)I'm actually due to visit a boy named Milos shortly, to see how he is responding to his treatment.
(-Alisaie-)You've met him before with Lamaty'i, I believe? The two of you should attend as well if you have time.
(-Erenville-)<Split(<Highlight>ObjectParameter(1)</Highlight>, ,1)/>, this is a surprise. Has Wuk Lamat gotten into trouble again?
(-Erenville-)...I see. Knowing you, I expect you're already looking forward to the next obvious trap. Try not to overdo it.
(-Erenville-)I'm in the outskirts at the moment. I've been helping the people with their work, and talking to those I meet to gauge their sentiment.
(-Erenville-)It's been uneventful for the most part, but there was one notable development.
(-Erenville-)Following recent events, some here stopped wearing regulators. This has led to a disparity in what people remember about the queen's death, and the occasional episode of confusion.
(-Erenville-)I'll be sure to let you know if there are any other changes.
Being able to contact people so far away so easily can do wonders for your peace of mind. Linkpearls really are convenient things.
I see you were able to reach everyone. That is well.
I thought I heard Alisaie yelling. I hope everything is all right...
What did the others have to say, if I may ask?
They've finished treating Milos? Then we have to go and visit him!
Would you mind if I accompanied you? I understand he's afflicted with the selfsame condition as I was, and I cannot help but worry for him.
Of course, we don't mind at all.
In the meantime, I shall take myself around Solution Nine and see how things are.
I share Alphinaud's concern about the queen's absence. And even setting that aside, the situation is not like to resolve itself while becoming Endless remains an option.
I had been meaning to visit some shops, so I shall join Krile.
While everyone's out and about, I'll try to pick up Calyx's trail. I'll see if I can dig up some information about the key for Y'shtola as well.
I'll help you!
It seems we all have things to do. Still, there's no telling what else Calyx might have planned...so please be careful, everyone.
Right, let's go to Milos's apartment. It's in residential radius 9-14, if I remember correctly.
Lamaty'i told me all about Milos. She said he was around my age, but couldn't leave his bed.
I'd like to go meet him next time. Maybe we can be friends.
Calyx is more clever than anyone has any right to be, but I'll sniff him out somehow. Just leave it to me.
Look, Milos is sitting up! I'd seen the treatment before, so I knew it would work...but it's still so amazing! Alisaie and Y'shtola are miracle workers!
I understand my Endless self visited Milos often. I will keep quiet, so as to not draw suspicion.
There you are. Next time something is in the offing, you had better remember to call on me!
It's so good to see you again, and a delight to know that you and Alisaie are friends. She's been very kind to us.
H-Hello... You came before...with Queen Sphene... I'm glad...I'm glad you came again...
I believe he'll be fine now. But just for good measure, I'll administer a healing spell.
